metadata.proposal_title: Towards Effective Detection of N-Day Vulnerabilities in Third-Party Software Components

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes: The project is developing a model of binary code scanning for the identification of vulnerabilities through similarity detection. This is aligned with “Computational Science and Visualization -> Programming models”. Pytorch is a good software to develop the architecture of a model.

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes: No prohibited use/functionality is included in the scope of this project. The proposed AI model is to implement cybersecurity to scan the binary codes for vulnerabilities.

checks.name: Restricted Entities Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes: The requested software is from Non-D5 organizations. NVIDIA NGC.

checks.name: Source / Provenance
checks.notes: Source verified. nvcr.io/nvidia/pytorch:23.10-py3

checks.name: License / Permissions
checks.notes: Released under NVIDIA Software License Agreement/Product terms and conditions allows the intended use.

checks.name: Bundled Tools / Dependencies
checks.notes:
nvcr.io/nvidia/pytorch:23.10-py3 (base image: ubuntu 22.04)
Total: 4970 (UNKNOWN: 0, LOW: 465, MEDIUM: 4385, HIGH: 120, CRITICAL: 0).
Applicant will use Singularity container platform provided on Shaheen III GPUP for creating the container from the image.

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes: The project is developing a model of binary code scanning for the identification of vulnerabilities through similarity detection. This is aligned with “Computational Science and Visualization → Programming models”. The ubuntu image is requested so that LLVM compiler >18.0 can be installed. The requirement of the image and the compiler is justified because it will be used to create the required training dataset on the Shaheen III CPU and GPU.  A check in an in-person meeting is recommended to confirm that the created dataset is infact the one approved.

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes: No prohibited use/functionality is included in the scope of this project. The proposed AI model is to implement cybersecurity to scan the binary codes for vulnerabilities.

checks.name: Restricted Entities Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes: Canonical official image repo of Ubuntu. It is verified repo on DockerHub.

checks.name: License / Permissions
checks.notes: Released under Canonical IP rights policy – allows the intended use

 Applicant will use Singularity container platform provided on Shaheen III GPUP for creating the container from the image.

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes: The project is developing a model of binary code scanning for the identification of vulnerabilities through similarity detection. This is aligned with “Computational Science and Visualization → Programming models”. The LLVM version requested is possibly misquoted. 18.1.0 will be provided. It will be used to create the datasets on SIII GPUP and CPUP.

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes: No prohibited use/functionality is included in the scope of this project. The proposed AI model is to implement cybersecurity to scan the binary codes for vulnerabilities.

checks.name: Restricted Entities Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes:
The project is maintained by opensource community from https://llvm.org and https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project.git
The community is big and has a robust code review process. New code is accepted through PRs on Github and process has been explained here: https://llvm.org/docs/DeveloperPolicy.html#introducing-new-components-into-llvm
This is a popular backend compiler for many common compilers including HPE Cray compiler provided on SIII GPUP

checks.name: Source / Provenance
checks.notes:
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/archive/refs/tags/llvmorg-18.1.0.tar.gz
Github has over 5K PRs and 5K github issues. Its in active development.

checks.name: License / Permissions
checks.notes:
Apache 2.0 license variant: https://llvm.org/docs/DeveloperPolicy.html#copyright-license-and-patents
The use of LLVM compiler in the project fits the terms. Distribution of code requires the developers to include this license if LLVM or its component is shipped with it.

checks.name: Bundled Tools / Dependencies
checks.notes:
Dependencies to compile LLVM are available on SIII GPUP and CPUP. 
CMake, GCC 13+

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes: Code to create the dataset for pre-training and fine-tuning on Shaheen III CPUs/GPUs
